alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 4:11PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Pike County through 445 PM EDT... At 410 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lookout, or 7 miles northwest of John Flannagan Lake, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Elkhorn City, Belcher, Marrowbone, Cedarville and Garden Village around 415 PM EDT. Fishtrap Lake around 420 PM EDT. Biggs, Fedscreek, Phyllis, Mouthcard, Toonerville and Kimper around 425 PM EDT. Coleman and Mcandrews around 430 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Board Tree, Phelps, Jamboree, Argo, Paw Paw, Hardy, Majestic and Woodman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
